meanings.sent1: The writing on the old sign was indistinct, making it hard to read.
meanings.sent2: The image on the blurry photograph was indistinct, making it difficult to recognize.
meanings.sent3: The indistinct shadow in the dark alley turned out to be a playful cat.
meanings.sent4: Her memories of that day were indistinct, like faded watercolor paintings.
meanings.sent5: The distant figure in the fog was indistinct, adding an air of mystery to the scene.

meanings.sent1: The instructions were indistinct, causing confusion among the students.
meanings.sent2: His speech was indistinct, making it hard for others to understand him.
meanings.sent3: The indistinct outline of the drawing made it look like abstract art.
meanings.sent4: The path through the forest was indistinct, as if nature itself was unsure.
meanings.sent5: The indistinct boundaries between the colors created a beautiful blend in the painting.
